Pre-Game Insights: The Cincinnati Reds used an opener on Tuesday night against the Oakland Athletics, with Jakob Junis pitching four solid innings before turning the game over to reliever Buck Farmer and eventually using a total of six pitchers.
The Reds plan to use Fernando Cruz as the opener for Wednesday's game against the Athletics.
There may be transactions before the game, such as activating Brent Suter to replace Casey Legumina or recalling Yosver Zulueta or Connor Phillips to log some innings in relief.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Reds' strategy of using openers on back-to-back games against the Athletics is cited as a reason why MLB is considering rule changes to require starters to pitch deeper into games.
MLB Commissioner Rob Manfred and baseball fans want to see starters going deeper into games, with a six-inning minimum for starters being suggested.
